title: Lesson 52
paragraph: Achievement and talent adjectives, followed by basic feeling words to describe emotional states.

words.japaneseMeaning: 成功した／うまくいっている
words.example: Their project was successful and well received.

words.meaning: having a natural aptitude or skill

words.example: My friend is very talkative on the phone.

words.japaneseMeaning: きちんとした／整頓された
words.example: Keep your desk tidy for study.
He seemed unfriendly at the meeting.
After the flu, she still feels weak.

words.japaneseMeaning: 怖がっている／恐れている
words.example: He is afraid of the dark.
She was angry about the delay.

words.japaneseMeaning: 苛立っている／うんざりしている
words.example: He was annoyed by the loud noise.
She felt anxious before the exam.

words.meaning: feeling embarrassed or guilty about one's actions
words.japaneseMeaning: 恥ずかしい／罪悪感のある
words.example: He was ashamed of his behavior.

words.meaning: feeling weary because one is unoccupied or uninterested
words.example: I get bored during long meetings.
